intro: Loeselia glandulosa subsp. cervantesii, commonly known as the Cervantes' glandular loeselia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant is distinguished by its glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, which contribute to its unique botanical appearance. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
